Tk_Gui

Class Tk_Clock

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tk_Gui.Tk_Clock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Tk_Digital

    public abstract class Tk_Clock
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    Abstract Clock class. The idea being that it can be instantiated as either a digital or analog clock. Note: At present we only have the Tk_Digital version.
    Author:
    michaelwebster

    • Field Summary

      private javax.xml.datatype.Duration m_totalDuration
      The Duration that records how much time has been spent on the task across possibly multiple starts and stops of the task.
      protected Tk_ActiveTimeRecord m_tr
      An active time record that keeps track of the time, and can serialize its time records.

      • addDuration

        protected javax.xml.datatype.Duration addDuration(javax.xml.datatype.Duration cur_dur)
        Add Duration cur_dur to m_totalDuration and return the result Duration.
        Parameters:
        cur_dur - A Duration to be added to the m_totalDuration>.
        Returns:
        The Duration that is the sum of cur_dur and m_totalDuration.

      • getEl

        protected java.util.Vector<org.w3c.dom.Document> getEl(java.lang.String key)
        Return the Vector stored with key = key in this clock's mapping from tasknames to lists of documents.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the task we want to get the Vector of Documents for.
        Returns:
        A Vector containing Documents.

      • setUpClock

        protected void setUpClock()
        Create a new Tk_ActiveTime Record for this clock, initialised to the current time. Add an observer to the clock so that we can update the current time, the duration, and the total duration strings, when the active time record ticks.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Test if the clock is running - ie. the clock's active time record's timer is going.
        Returns:
        true => The active time record's timer is running. false => otherwise.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable tatr,
          java.lang.Object o)
        Update displays for the current time, duration and total duration fields when the active time record notifies of a timer tick.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer

      • startClock

        public void startClock()

      • stopClock

        public void stopClock()
        Stop the Tk_ActiveTimeRecord m_tr task timer, and update the m_totalDuration field. Get an xml Document serialization of the Tk_ActiveTimeRecord m_tr store it and then setup the clock for the next time recording.

      • switchTasks

        public void switchTasks(java.lang.String new_task)
        Switch to a new task by creating and setting up the title border with the new task name, and initializing the m_totalDuration field.
        Parameters:
        new_task - The name of the task to switch to.
